titleStmt.title: The second part of an argument shewing that a standing army is inconsistent with a free government, and absolutely destructive to the constitution of the English monarchy with remarks on the late published list of King James's Irish forces in France.
An argument shewing, that a standing army is inconsistent with a free government. Part 2
titleStmt.author: Moyle, Walter, 1672-1721.

notesStmt.note: The first part, entitled, "An argument shewing, that a standing army is inconsistent with a free government," was written by John Trenchard and Walter Moyle. It is often thought Trenchard also assisted in the second part; however attributed solely to Moyle by BM, Wing, and Halkett and Laing.
Reproduction of original in Bristol Public Library, Bristol, England.
